---
title: "Writing Mathematical Expressions in RMarkdown"
author: "John Vinson"
date: "8/29/2017"
output: pdf_document
---

We can write equations like this


\begin{equation}
y = mx+b
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
z = yx +c +d
\end{equation}

We can align our equations with 
\begin{align}
y = mx &+b\\
z &= yx +c
\end{align}

In line we can write equations like this $N_t = N_0 e^{rt}$. 

Special characters 
\begin{equation}
\tau \lambda \Psi \psi
\end{equation}
